meanings.sent1: The judge had to disannul the incorrect ruling.
meanings.sent2: She decided to disannul the contract due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to disannul the disappearing act, but he forgot to bring the rabbit back!
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to disannul all signs of life in the small town.
meanings.sent5: The eraser was so powerful, it could disannul any mistake on the paper.

meanings.sent1: The company had to disannul the faulty product before it caused harm.
meanings.sent2: He had to disannul his travel plans due to unexpected work commitments.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to disannul the test results by claiming the dog ate his homework.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise seemed to disannul all thoughts from her mind.
meanings.sent5: The detective's evidence was enough to disannul the suspect's alibi.
